attributes.action: Demand accountability for the money being spent by the government on Covid 19.
attributes.additional_details: The government appear to be able to spend vast sums of public money with little or no accountability. The failing multi billion pound test and trace system,  has resulted in many damaging local lockdown and a second national lockdown is imminent. The government must be held to account for so much money spent for so little return.
attributes.background: Vast sums of money have been given to small inexperienced start up companies, to deliver PPE. The test and trace system has cost many billions of pounds of taxpayers money even though it's apparently unfit for purpose. The public need to know the truth, where has the money gone for so little return.

rejection.details:
We understand you want Government to be held accountable for its spending related to the Covid-19 pandemic, but it's not clear how you want this to happen. Parliament already holds the Government to account for the value-for-money of its projects, programmes and service delivery through the work of the Public Account Committee: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/127/public-accounts-committee. Government spending is also scrutinised by the independent National Audit Office: https://www.nao.org.uk/.

Further, requests for information about spending on specific projects can be made through the Freedom of Information scheme: https://www.gov.uk/make-a-freedom-of-information-request.

You may instead wish to sign this petition which calls for a related action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/328408

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
